abstract: Launch templates are a new way to interact with Amazon EC2. They allow Amazon EC2 customers to define a configuration, persist it, and reuse it across many Amazon EC2 products/APIs. In this chalk talk, we look into specifics of launch templates, various scenarios and use cases, and how to use them with Amazon EC2 RunInstances, Spot Fleet, and Auto Scaling APIs. With launch templates, we are truly reinventing Amazon EC2. Join us and discover how you can achieve the benefits of launch templates.

title: [REPEAT 1] Beyond DevOps: Accelerating Organizational Agility with Serverless
abstract: In today's tech-driven world, an organization's architecture is a competitive differentiator. Serverless enables the new era of modern application development and organizational agility. In this session, we start with a brief history of DevOps and show how serverless is a stepwise shift for developer agility. Then, we go beyond DevOps to talk about how serverless is uniquely positioned to accelerate agility between development and business intelligence, enabling IT to become the ultimate strategic partner to business.

title: Architecting Security & Governance across a Multi-Account Strategy
abstract: Whether it is per business unit or per application, many AWS customers use multiple accounts to meet their infrastructure isolation, separation of duties, and billing requirements. In this session, we discuss considerations, limitations, and security patterns when building a multi-account strategy. We explore topics such as mindset approach, identity federation, cross-account roles, consolidated logging, and account governance. At the end of the session, we present an enterprise-ready landing zone framework and provide the background needed to implement an AWS Landing Zone.

title: [REPEAT 1] Build Deep Learning Applications Using TensorFlow and Amazon SageMaker
abstract: Deep learning continues to push the state of the art in computer vision, language applications, and more. In this workshop, learn how to get started with the TensorFlow deep learning framework using Amazon SageMaker, a fully managed platform to build, train, and deploy machine learning models at scale. Learn how to build a model using TensorFlow by setting up a Jupyter notebook for image and object recognition. Use bring-your-own-code and bring-your-own-algorithm techniques to develop your deep learning model. Once the model is built, learn how to train and deploy it using Amazon SageMaker.

title: Leverage AWS Innovation to Deliver Game-Changing Business Solutions
abstract: The leading pace of AWS innovation and new services creates new market opportunities for APN partners to build transformational business solutions. Customer sophistication with AWS services is raising the bar for partners to move beyond baseline deployments by leveraging and combining newer AWS services into your practice and solution offerings. We went to all corners of the globe to collect examples of some of the top innovative business solutions from our APN partners in order to provide you with best practice ideas to create transformational business solutions that will delight your customers. Come learn about these growing customer opportunities along with the APN tools, training, and programs that will help you translate new AWS services into transformational business solutions that enable deeper, more profitable relationships with your customers.

title: [REPEAT] Automate Manual Processes and Instrument Your Manufacturing Factory
abstract: In this session, we explain how combining IoT and AI technologies such as computer vision enables you to increase productivity of a manufacturing process. Using AWS IoT services and analytics, we show how you can sense and control environmental conditions. Finally, we show how to quickly transition from a patrol-based model to a notification-based model for replenishment scenarios.

title: Extending Data Centers to the Cloud: Connectivity Options and Best Practices
abstract: Many enterprises on their journey to the cloud require consistent and highly secure connectivity between their existing data center and AWS footprints. In this session, we walk through the different architecture options for establishing this connectivity using AWS Direct Connect and VPN. With each option, we evaluate the considerations and discuss risk, performance, high availability, encryption, and cost. As we walk through these options, we discuss the associated best practices and answer some of the common questions that arise from enterprises that tackle design and implementation. Learn how to make connectivity decisions that are suitable for your workloads and how to best prepare against business impact in the event of failure.

title: Modernizing Windows Applications with Containers
abstract: Interested in learning more about microservice architectures for .NET applications running on AWS? In this chalk talk, we baseline .NET microservices architectures and answer all of your questions about .NET and microservices on AWS. This is an interactive question-and-answer session, so please bring your questions and join us for this discussion.

title: [REPEAT] Choose the Right Amazon EC2 Instance for General-Purpose Workloads
abstract: Customers often wonder which Amazon EC2 instance is right for their general-purpose workloads. In this session, we review the key differences between the two Amazon EC2 instances, M and T instances, as well as considerations to help you better decide which is the right instance for your needs.

title: Airbnb's Journey from Self-Managed Redis to ElastiCache for Redis
abstract: At Airbnb, we use Redis extensively as an in-memory data store to reduce latency and provide sub-millisecond response for our website, search, images, payments, and more. We migrated our self-managed Redis environment from EC2 classic to fully-managed Amazon ElastiCache for Redis to reduce operational overhead and improve availability. Now, all our Redis is in an AWS managed service that provides multi-Availability Zone support, automatic failover, and maintenance. Attend this session to learn how we migrated our Redis environment while ensuring data integrity and zero downtime.

title: [REPEAT 1] Managing Application Costs and Performance Using AWS Auto Scaling
abstract: In this session, learn how AWS Auto Scaling enables you to configure scaling for all your application resources in as few as three steps.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom B, Table 1, T1

title: [REPEAT] Build a Query to Analyze Data in Your Amazon Redshift Warehouse & S3 Data Lake Together
abstract: Not all of your data is always loaded into your data warehouse, and yet sometimes anaysts need access to it quickly, without waiting on an ETL job to load it. This sessions takes a hands-on approach to show you how to mine your Amazon S3 data lake using open data formats with Amazon Redshift Spectrum, a feature of Amazon Redshift, without the need for unnecessary data movement. This enables you to analyze data across your data warehouse and data lake together, with a single service.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom B, Table 4, T1

title: [REPEAT] Building Your First Serverless Data Lake
abstract: In this session, you have the opportunity to learn the fundamental building blocks of a data lake on AWS. You design and build a serverless pipeline to ingest, process, optimize and query data in your very own data lake. We discuss different optimizations and best practices to tune your architecture for future growth.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom D, Table 4, T1

title: [REPEAT 3] Migrate Your First SQL Server Database to Amazon RDS for SQL Server
abstract: With the approaching end of support for Microsoft SQL Server 2008, it is important to understand your options for upgrading the database layer of your existing applications. The fully managed Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) for SQL Server makes it easy to upgrade, set up, operate, and scale your SQL Server business applications for high availability. Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to learn how to migrate a SQL Server database to Amazon RDS.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom D, Table 7, T1

title: How Jupiter Intel Uses AWS to Forecast Weather Impact & Climate Risk
abstract: Jupiter is a cloud-native company that delivers hyperlocal environmental information in a changing climate, primarily using AWS Batch. Through AWS Batch’s capability to execute thousands of scientific modeling jobs while managing scale and cost, Jupiter scientists can focus on data analysis and developing sophisticated machine learning (ML)-based applications to support private sector and local municipality customers; AWS Batch takes care of the rest. In this chalk talk, we demonstrate how AWS Batch, through managing resource provisioning and scheduling, enables flexibility across changing requirements to allow various modeling applications to run quickly and at scale.

title: [REPEAT 1] Build a .NET CI/CD Pipeline with AWS & AWS Tools for Visual Studio Team Services
abstract: Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to build a .NET CI/CD pipeline with AWS and AWS Tools for Visual Studio Team Services.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom D, Table 1, T1

title: [REPEAT 1] Build a Serverless .NET App on AWS Using the AWS Toolkit for Visual Studio
abstract: Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to learn how to create and deploy a .NET serverless app on AWS using the AWS Toolkit for Visual Studio.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom D, Table 3, T1

title: AWS Encryption SDK: The Busy Engineer's Guide to Client-Side Encryption
abstract: Do you want client-side encryption for your service, but don’t know exactly where to start? In this hands-on workshop, we review your client-side encryption options and explore implementing client-side encryption using the AWS Encryption SDK in Java, Python, and C. We cover the basics of client-side encryption, perform encrypt and decrypt operations using AWS KMS and the AWS Encryption SDK, and discuss security and performance considerations when implementing client-side encryption in your service. Bring a laptop, and be sure that you have an active AWS account with Administrator privileges before the workshop.

title: [REPEAT] Building Automated Actions Using AWS Trusted Advisor Checks
abstract: By using AWS Trusted Advisor checks in conjunction with AWS Lambda, AWS Step Functions, and AWS Systems Manager, we build from scratch automation to reduce risk, improve security, and optimize performance.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom D, Table 2, T1

title: [REPEAT 1] Build a Video Recommendation Engine with Amazon ML & Neptune
abstract: In this session, learn how to build a video recommendation engine by leveraging Amazon machine learning services and the new, fully managed graph database service, Amazon Neptune. You use Amazon Transcribe and the natural language processing service, Amazon Comprehend, to transcribe and extract metadata, such as key phrases, entities, topics, and sentiment from video blogs. The resulting connected metadata is organized into an Amazon Neptune graph database and used to drive recommendations for related videos.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom D, Table 6, T1

title: Machine Learning and Predictive Quality Management
abstract: From refined products to heavy crude, Four-Path Ultrasonic Flow Meters offers the capability to minimize measurement uncertainty of liquid hydrocarbons. Attendees work to build a machine learning (ML) predictive quality management (PQM) solution on AWS to proactively predict the health of the ultrasonic flow meters. This is done using the ML Data Readiness Package based on KNIME, from AWS Marketplace. Another PQM example for attendees to explore uses features extracted from motor current measured with a current probe and an oscilloscope on two phases measured under different speeds, load moments, and load forces. ML is used to proactively classify whether the motor has intact or defective components. A third PQM example involves using raw process sensor data from a hydraulic test rig with a primary working and a secondary cooling-filtration circuit, connected via the oil tank. They then use ML on AWS to proactively predict the cooler condition, hydraulic accumulator condition, internal pump leakage condition, and valve condition.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom B, Table 5, T1

title: [REPEAT 1] Build High-Performance Apps with Amazon ElastiCache
abstract: Amazon ElastiCache offers fully managed Redis and Memcached, which you can use to seamlessly deploy, run, and scale popular open-source compatible in-memory data stores. Come to this session to learn how to build data-intensive apps or improve the performance of your existing apps by retrieving data from high throughput and low latency in-memory data stores.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom B, Table 2, T1

title: [REPEAT] The State Machine: Create Dynamic, Interactive AR, VR, & 3D Experiences
abstract: In this session, learn to use the state machine to bring behaviors and interactivity to objects within their scene. Together, we create an interactive 3D scene using primitive shapes and basic objects. Learn how to import assets, change their position within a scene, and creative interactive behaviors using the state machine.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom B, Table 7, T1

title: [REPEAT 4] Add In-Skill Purchasing to an Alexa Skill
abstract: In this session, we start with a basic Alexa skill, and then we integrate in-skill purchasing to enable products to be purchased using voice.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom B, Table 9, T1

title: [REPEAT 4] Designing the Voice User Interface for an Alexa Skill
abstract: In this session, discover the process of thinking through the design of a voice experience using intents, slots, entity resolution, and dialog management.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom D, Table 10, T1

title: [REPEAT 3] Build Your First Alexa Skill
abstract: We start from scratch, and in an hour, you will have an Alexa skill working end to end.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom B, Table 10, T1

title: [REPEAT 1] Move Your First Application to the Cloud with Amazon Lightsail
abstract: Ever wonder exactly how to get started with AWS? In this session, come spend time with the Amazon Lightsail team, and move one of your applications to the cloud. We sit down with you and help you deploy a workload on AWS using Amazon Lightsail. So bring your own workload or use one of our demo examples, and get started today.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom B, Table 6, T1

title: Leverage AWS Cost Management Tooling for Cost & Usage Optimization
abstract: In this hands-on session, we guide you through the AWS tools and services for driving cost optimization.  We review the core tools, such as IAM policies, AWS Budgets, and Cost Explorer. We then go deeper into advanced billing analysis with Amazon Athena and Amazon QuickSight.
rooms: Mirage, Mirage Event Center C3, T1

title: [REPEAT 1] Configure Your Cloud to Make It Rain on Threats
abstract: Security on AWS is robust and feature rich, but how do you know what to do and how to start? This workshop covers how to start your AWS threat response automation platform using native AWS tools and OSS. We begin with how to collect and analyze all the different data sources in an AWS account. Next, we cover how to take that log data and automatically address risks identified from network intrusion, insider threats, or misconfigurations. We also cover preventative controls that can help block risk in the first place and alert you when drift occurs. Finally, we cover how to scale this all out to multiple accounts.

title: [REPEAT 2] Use Amazon MQ to Connect On-Premises Messaging to the Cloud
abstract: In this session, learn how to use Amazon MQ to connect IBM MQ to the AWS cloud. We demonstrate how to set up an Amazon MQ message broker and start sending messages from IBM MQ to Amazon MQ.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom D, Table 5, T1

title: [REPEAT 1] Well-Operated: The CIO’s Guide to Modern Cloud Operations
abstract: Successful enterprise cloud adoption is about more than just migration. Considering the impact that the cloud has on operations staff and their day-to-day work too late in the process can lead to frustrated teams, delayed project timelines, and lost value. Well-Operated is series of cloud operations best practices for people, process, and technology. In this session, learn how to integrate existing operational models (e.g., ITIL) with modern cloud best practices (e.g., DevOps). Learn how to structure your team to delight your internal and external customers, and learn how other CIOs are leveraging the “Well Operated” framework to run their business. Finally, learn how to measure success in your own business.

title: [REPEAT 1] Stop Backing Up to Tape Now
abstract: Tapes. If they're still coming in and out of your data center, and you don't love dealing with them, join our AWS expert to learn how you can set up the AWS Storage Gateway service as a virtual tape library. You get the opportunity to deploy a tape gateway that works with your existing backup applications on-premises. Start your switch to cloud backups today without changing your workflows. Bring a laptop with remote access to your on-premises VM infrastructure, available memory and disk space for cache, and access to your existing backup application.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom B, Table 3, T1

title: [REPEAT] Building Modern Platforms: A Practical Way to Migrate Legacy Systems to Amazon SQS
abstract: Learn how Comcast addressed their data quality and system resiliency issues by using AWS technologies such as Amazon SQS, Amazon SNS, Amazon DynamoDB, Elasticsearch, and Logstash to replace a legacy messaging system. The new messaging system, Publish Subscribe Platform (PSP), interconnects customer management, billing, and provisioning applications. It is becoming the core platform for Comcast's next generation billing transformation program. Comcast shares the best practices, scaling considerations, and migration strategies they employed.

title: [REPEAT 1] Get Started with Deep Learning and Computer Vision Using AWS DeepLens
abstract: If you're new to deep learning, this workshop is for you. Learn how to build and deploy computer vision models using the AWS DeepLens deep learning-enabled video camera. Also learn to build a machine learning application and a model from scratch using Amazon SageMaker. Finally, learn to extend that model to Amazon SageMaker to build an end-to-end AI application.

title: [REPEAT] Building Serverless Machine Learning Workflows
abstract: Modern machine learning workflows leverage AWS services, such as Amazon Transcribe and Amazon Comprehend, to extract, validate, mutate, and enrich your data. Some might drive transactional systems that use machine learning to generate metadata for media assets, while others might derive insights by visualizing customer interaction sentiment from call logs. They all share a common challenge: orchestrating a combination of distinct sequential and parallel steps that are fulfilled by independent microservices. Join us as we examine how workflows can be used to manage that orchestration in a way that is scalable, reliable, and easy to maintain and run. We contrast two approaches for creating such workflows: a traditional monolithic approach and a serverless approach utilizing AWS Steps Functions.

title: Optimizing Storage for Enterprise Workloads and Migrations
abstract: In this session, we focus on best practices for AWS block and file storage when supporting enterprise workloads (like SAP, Oracle, Microsoft applications, and home directories). We discuss migrating mission-critical workload data, selecting volumes or file systems, optimizing performance, and designing for durability and availability. We also review optimizing for cost to ensure that your lift-and-shift project is a success.
rooms: Mirage, Mirage Event Center B, T2

title: [REPEAT 1] Architecting for the Cloud
abstract: Bring your ideas, war stories, and "aha moments" to this interactive session with an AWS solutions architect, where we discuss cloud architecture best practices. We highlight specific "light bulb" moments for AWS customers as the cloud redefined how they think about scalability, designing for failure, constrained thinking, elasticity, parallel processing, loose coupling, and more. Come with your own story or an interest in learning how AWS forever changed the way your colleagues think about the IT world.

title: How Fannie Mae Processes over a Quarter Million Loans per Day with Amazon S3
abstract: In this session, Fannie Mae discusses how they completely re-architected a mission-critical application using AWS native services that process hundreds of thousands of mortgage loans every day in a highly scalable and reliable manner. The transaction-heavy workload uses over 20+ million Amazon S3 transactions a day, each within 150-millisecond response times, thus providing increased uptime and faster response.

title: [REPEAT] Query in Place with AWS
abstract: AWS supports a robust suite of tools and services that makes analyzing and processing large amounts of data in the cloud faster and more efficient. In this builders session, AWS storage and data experts guide you through Amazon S3, Amazon Glacier, and our query-in-place services such as Amazon S3 Select, Amazon Glacier Select, Amazon Athena, and Amazon Redshift Spectrum. We also provide best practices around using them with other analytics services like Amazon EMR and AWS Glue to build data lakes and deploy other analytics solutions. Understanding of a data lake construct, AWS storage services, and AWS analytics tools is recommended.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom D, Table 2, T1

title: Build Human-in-the-Loop Systems with AWS Lambda and Mechanical Turk
abstract: Building human-in-the-loop solutions can be very effective, but integrating humans into existing ML or business process workflows can be complex. Learn how you can easily connect the Amazon Mechanical Turk (Mechanical Turk) on-demand human intelligence platform with other AWS services, such as Amazon S3, Amazon Lex, Amazon Polly, and Amazon Rekognition with AWS Lambda.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom B, Table 3, T1

title: [REPEAT 1] Set Up a Serverless CI/CD Pipeline with AWS CodeStar
abstract: In this session, you start your first serverless application using AWS CodeStar to set up a CI/CD. Then, we debug our AWS Lambda functions using AWS Serverless Application Model (AWS SAM) Local with AWS Cloud9. Finally, we learn about monitoring distributed applications with AWS X-Ray and Amazon CloudWatch.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom D, Table 8, T1

title: [REPEAT] What Shall I Wear Today? Modifying the Appearance of Your Sumerian Host
abstract: In this session, learn about the different ways you can customize the appearance of your Sumerian Host. We developed these customizations based on customer feedback. Discover how you can choose among four outfits for your Host, the color of those outfits, as well as your own specific logo. See how the different ways to configure the Host's appearance enables you to create a virtual avatar that is authentic to the experience you want to create and to your brand.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom B, Table 6, T1

title: [REPEAT 4] Add Screen Support to an Alexa Skill
abstract: In this session, you work with Echo Show to see how to add visual components to your conversational experiences.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom B, Table 4, T1

title: [REPEAT 5] Add In-Skill Purchasing to an Alexa Skill
abstract: In this session, we start with a basic Alexa skill, and then we integrate in-skill purchasing to enable products to be purchased using voice.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom D, Table 4, T1

title: [REPEAT] IoT Microcontrollers and Getting Started with Amazon FreeRTOS
abstract: Come explore the challenges of embedded development, and learn to use Amazon FreeRTOS to solve these challenges. We cover differentiated features, such as tickless mode for low power consumption and the ecosystem of tools available for development, test, and debug. We also discuss use cases and their choice of microcontroller architecture.

title: [REPEAT 1] Scale up a Web Application
abstract: In this session, you use an automated test suite to bombard an application with an increasing number of concurrent users. You then identify the bottlenecks and refactor the application. Find out how many concurrent users can you get to.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom B, Table 8, T1

title: [REPEAT 1] Learn to Safely Deploy OTA Updates with AWS IoT Device Management
abstract: Interested in knowing how you can safely deploy over-the-air (OTA) updates with AWS IoT Device Management? In this session, learn how AWS IoT Device Management allows you to push software and firmware to devices in the field to patch security vulnerabilities and improve device functionality.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom D, Table 1, T1

title: Creating Rich, Interactive Business Dashboards in Amazon QuickSight
abstract: Are you ready to move past static email reports, Excel spreadsheets, and one-time queries? In this session, learn to build a rich and interactive business dashboard in Amazon QuickSight that allows your business stakeholders to filter, slice and dicem and deep dive on their own. We’ll demonstrate some advanced QuickSight capabilities such as creating on sheet filter controls, parameters, custom URLs, and table calculations to create powerful, easy-to-use, and interactive executive dashboards.

title: [REPEAT] Deploy Serverless Apps with Python: AWS Chalice Deep Dive
abstract: AWS Chalice is a microframework for writing serverless applications in Python. It enables you to write and deploy serverless applications in minutes. In this session, we take a deep dive into Chalice. We take a sample Chalice application and walk through how Chalice builds and deploys it. This includes the deployment planner, automatic IAM policy generation, and how Chalice builds AWS Lambda deployment packages for Python. Come and hear from the core Chalice developers about best practices and how to get the most of the microframework. You'll be able to quickly develop and deploy serverless applications in no time.

title: [REPEAT 1] Build AWS CloudFormation Custom Resources
abstract: Custom resources enable AWS CloudFormation customers to write customized provisioning logic in templates. Such logic can be useful in changing how existing resources get created, changed, or deleted, or in including resources that are not available as supported resource types. In this session, we cover best practices, including when to use custom resources versus other programmatic alternatives. We also cover existing custom resources that are available for download and reuse.

title: [REPEAT] Optimize Performance and Reduce Risk Using AWS Support Tools
abstract: To help manage the risk of downtime, AWS Support offers tools, such as Personal Health Dashboard (PHD) and Trusted Advisor (TA), that enable you to monitor your environments and automate actions for compliance with best practices. In this session, we review how AWS Support tools monitor your resources, provide alerts for issues, and automate best practice recommendations and remediation. We also showcase the integration of these tools with Alexa for Business to make it easier to access information about your AWS environment just by asking Alexa. Join us to see how you can optimize your AWS environment and reduce risk by implementing automation of AWS best practice recommendations from with AWS Support tools. Bring your own laptop.
rooms: Mirage, Mirage Event Center C3, T1

title: [REPEAT] Working with Metadata in AWS Glue Data Catalog & Amazon Athena
abstract: Schema on read, enabled by the separation of metadata and compute, is a powerful feature of Amazon Athena. In this session, we dive deeper into how to better utilize this concept, properly plan for schema evolution, design efficient partitioning scheme, and apply other tips and tricks for working with metadata.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom D, Table 2, T1

title: [REPEAT] Shared Services VPCs: VPC Peering & AWS PrivateLink Designs
abstract: This is a hands-on session where you are guided on how to create a shared services VPC. Shared services VPCs often contain resources like authentication, security services, logging, and more. We provide examples of how to share these services over both AWS PrivateLink and VPC peering. Bring your laptops.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom D, Table 5, T1

title: [REPEAT 1] AWS Systems Manager for Microsoft Workloads
abstract: Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to build a management and patching strategy with AWS Systems Manager for on-premise and cloud resources.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom B, Table 3, T1

title: [REPEAT] Modernize Your First Windows Application with Windows Containers
abstract: Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to modernize a sample .NET application to run inside a Windows container from start to finish in 60 minutes.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom B, Table 4, T1

title: [REPEAT 1] Machine Learning Transcription: Tips & Tricks
abstract: Amazon Transcribe is an automatic speech recognition service that makes it easy for developers to add speech-to-text capability to their applications. Join us and learn how you can build machine transcription into your existing workflows, such as transcribing videos for search engines or captioning.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom D, Table 1, T1

title: [REPEAT 1] Replicate & Manage Data Using Managed Databases & Serverless Technologies
abstract: Organizations often have disparate datasets and find it challenging to replicate and analyze the data to drive positive business outcomes. This workshop leverages AWS managed database services and serverless technologies to help replicate, manage, and analyze data using an MLB dataset. We replicate a SQL Server database to Amazon Aurora Serverless using AWS Database Migration Service (AWS DMS) and AWS Schema Conversion Tool. At the same time, we use AWS Glue, a serverless ETL service, to transform and load the data to Amazon S3. We then use Amazon Athena to interactively analyze data using SQL to enable better business decisions. In the course of this workshop, we use: Amazon EC2, Amazon Aurora Serverless, AWS DMS, Amazon Athena, AWS Glue, and Amazon S3. Have an AWS account and some experience with databases and SQL. Bring your own laptop
rooms: Mirage, Mirage Event Center C1, T1

title: [REPEAT 5] Designing the Voice User Interface for an Alexa Skill
abstract: In this session, discover the process of thinking through the design of a voice experience using intents, slots, entity resolution, and dialog management.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom B, Table 7, T1

title: [REPEAT 1] Getting Started with Containers Using Amazon Lightsail
abstract: Containers help you package your code so it can reliably run anywhere. However, deploying containers in the cloud can be complex and requires you to set up and manage multiple systems. In this chalk talk, learn how Amazon Lightsail makes it easy to start using containers with AWS. We cover when you should use Lightsail to run and scale containerized web apps and how to migrate from Lightsail to container services like Amazon ECS and Amazon EKS.

title: [REPEAT 4] Build Your First Alexa Skill
abstract: We start from scratch, and in an hour, you will have an Alexa skill working end to end.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom D, Table 7, T1

title: A Chronicle of Airbnb Architecture Evolution
abstract: Airbnb is going through tremendous growth internationally, evolving from a home sharing company to a global travel community with many product offerings. The growth driven by the business, increase in traffic, and aggressive hiring created a new challenge for the Production Infrastructure Team. The team has grown from a small team of 10 to a production platform organization with 100 engineers that builds foundational services that support homes, experiences, luxury, and China.  We shifted our priority and focus to move away from putting out fires to building a platform that can grow with the company. In this session, we chronicle Airbnb’s architectural evolution that aligns with organizational growth strategy, and review how we overcame different architectural challenges leveraging AWS technologies.

title: [REPEAT 1] Customizing the Environment in Your AR/VR Scene
abstract: An important aspect of developing immersive applications is the creation of a complete engaging environment. In this session, we show you how to modify the lighting, background, sky spheres, and sky boxes—settings for your scene that surround and establish the foundation for your immersive application.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom B, Table 9, T1

title: How Vanguard and Bloomberg Use AWS PrivateLink
abstract: Vanguard and Bloomberg's use of AWS PrivateLink as they moved from a small number of large accounts to a large number of small accounts reduced blast radius at the management plane but introduced significant complexity at the network layer. In this session, we introduce the type of network segmentation that is required to implement a zero-trust network for a highly regulated financial investment company like Vanguard—one that adds additional complexity.

title: [REPEAT 1] Deep Learning for Edge to Cloud
abstract: In this workshop, you step into the role of a startup that has assumed the challenge of providing a new type of EDM music festival experience. Your goal is to use machine learning (ML) to develop a connected fan experience that enhances the festival. Come and get hands-on experience with Amazon SageMaker, AWS DeepLens, Amazon Rekognition, and AWS Lambda as you build and deploy an ML model and then run inference on it from edge devices.

title: [REPEAT] Deploy Alexa for Business in Your Organization, & Build Your First Private Skill
abstract: Alexa for Business enables you to deploy and manage Alexa skills for your organization. You can use Alexa skills to create smart conference rooms, help employees be more productive, and even create unique experience for your customers. In this workshop, you have a chance to get hands on with the Alexa for Business service. You create an Alexa for Business organization, set up a private skills catalog, build and use a private skill to create tickets in ServiceNow, and publish the skill to your catalog. Finally, you set up personal device enrollment. Bring your existing AWS account. No previous Alexa experience required.
rooms: Mirage, Mirage Event Center C2, T2

title: [REPEAT] Reinventing Amazon EC2 Instance Launches with Launch Templates
abstract: Launch templates are a new way to interact with Amazon EC2. They allow Amazon EC2 customers to define a configuration, persist it, and reuse it across many Amazon EC2 products/APIs. In this chalk talk, we look into specifics of launch templates, various scenarios and use cases, and how to use them with Amazon EC2 RunInstances, Spot Fleet, and Auto Scaling APIs. With launch templates, we are truly reinventing Amazon EC2. Join us and discover how you can achieve the benefits of launch templates.

title: [REPEAT 1] Alexa for Device Makers: Create Products with Alexa Built-In Using AVS
abstract: In this hands-on workshop, learn how to use Alexa Built-In to create products that you can talk to and use to access music, information, control smart-home devices, and all of Alexa's skills. We use the C++-based AVS Device SDK and a Raspberry Pi to access the cloud-based Alexa Voice Service (AVS). Leave this session with your own working prototype and the knowledge to bring your products to market.

title: AWS Direct Connect: Deep Dive
abstract: AWS Direct Connect provides a more consistent network experience for accessing your AWS resources, typically with greater bandwidth and reduced network costs. This session dives deep into the features of AWS Direct Connect, including public and private virtual Interfaces, Direct Connect Gateway, global access, local preference communities, and more.

title: We Power Tech: Everyday Actions to Be a Better Ally
abstract: Have you ever thought, "I care about a more diverse and inclusive workplace, but what can I do? I’m not the VP of HR or Head of Diversity & Inclusion at my company." If so, you’re not alone. Knowing how to be a better ally for underrepresented people working in tech is unfamiliar territory for many of us. Yet, there are everyday actions we can take to create a more diverse and inclusive culture. Come to this session to learn about key challenges women and underrepresented minorities face in our tech workplaces and ways you can make a difference. Learn tips on how to sponsor, champion, amplify, and advocate for all.
rooms: Mirage, Mirage Event Center B, T2

title: [REPEAT] AIOPs - Find Your Needle in the Haystack
abstract: In this session, learn how to architect a predictive and preventative remediation solution for your applications and infrastructure resources. We show you how to collect performance and operational intelligence, understand and predict patterns using AI & ML, and fix issues. We show you how to do all this by using AWS native solutions: Amazon SageMaker and Amazon CloudWatch.

title: AWS Tools for PowerShell
abstract: Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to explore several PowerShell use cases on AWS.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom D, Table 1, T1

title: [REPEAT] Empower Lean Teams with Centrally Crafted CI/CD Pipelines Using AWS CodePipeline & AWS CloudFormation
abstract: In this one-hour session, you build a pipeline product that your lean teams can use to bring their application code, tests, and infrastructure to be vetted, executed, approved, and eventually published with AWS CloudFormation.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom B, Table 4, T1

title: [REPEAT 1] Entering VR: Create and Publish a Virtual Reality Scene with Sumerian
abstract: In this session, we walk you through the process of creating an immersive application that is then published and consumed via virtual reality (VR). The one-click publishing feature in Amazon Sumerian enables you to build once and then publish to an array of devices. Sumerian supports Oculus Rift, Oculus Go, HTC Vive, HTC Vive Pro, Lenovo Mirage Solo, and Google Daydream headsets, which run a compatible browser and enable the user to experience the scene in VR.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom B, Table 6, T1

title: [REPEAT 2] Build on Amazon Aurora with MySQL Compatibility
abstract: Amazon Aurora is a MySQL- and PostgreSQL-compatible relational database with the speed, reliability, and availability of commercial databases at one-tenth the cost. Join this session, and get started with the MySQL-compatible edition, discuss your existing application running on Aurora, or learn about recently announced features, such as Serverless or Parallel Query.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom B, Table 5, T1

title: [REPEAT 5] Add Screen Support to an Alexa Skill
abstract: In this session, you work with Echo Show to see how to add visual components to your conversational experiences.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom B, Table 2, T1

title: [REPEAT 6] Add In-Skill Purchasing to an Alexa Skill
abstract: In this session, we start with a basic Alexa skill, and then we integrate in-skill purchasing to enable products to be purchased using voice.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom D, Table 8, T1

title: [REPEAT 1]  Automate Common Maintenance & Deployment Tasks Using AWS Systems Manager
abstract: AWS Systems Manager provides predefined automation documents for common operational tasks that can be customized to meet your specific use cases. In this session, learn how to build new or customize existing automation documents leveraging predefined documents, automation plugins, and environment variables. Use Systems Manager’s built-in rate controls to incrementally and safely roll out changes when stopping, starting, or restarting Amazon EC2 instances, updating Linux and Windows Amazon Machine Images, or updating software on multiple Amazon EC2 instances.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom B, Table 9, T1

title: [REPEAT] Sizing Amazon Elasticsearch Service for Your Workload Needs
abstract: Amazon Elasticsearch Service (Amazon ES) provides you with a great deal of flexibility in selecting the instance type and count for your data and master instances. In this session, we talk over your workload, the choices you can make, and how to optimize your Amazon ES deployment for cost and latency.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom D, Table 7, T1

title: [REPEAT 1] Building Multi-Region Microservices
abstract: In this session, participate in a hands-on exercise where you create, verify, and test a serverless solution across multiple regions using AWS Lambda and Amazon DynamoDB global tables.
rooms: Aria West, Level 3, Starvine 3, Table 8, T1

title: Build Models for Aerial Images Using Amazon SageMaker
abstract: There are unique challenges to building highly accurate models that detect small objects in aerial and overhead imagery. In this chalk talk, we dive deep into using convolutional neural networks (CNNs) with Amazon SageMaker in order to build and train aerial object detection models. We build advanced models using AWS public datasets, such as SpaceNet and LandSat, as we work with DigitalGlobe's GBDX Notebooks.

title: Detect Anomalies & Fraud in Your Games Using Amazon SageMaker & ML
abstract: Game studios build specialized tools and processes to detect fraud and anomalies in their games. In addition to increasing development costs per game, it also impacts player experience, and processing time to resolve player issues. In this chalk talk, we review how studios could use a trained machine learning (ML) system to improve anomalies and fraud detection.

title: [REPEAT 1] Securing Your Virtual Data Center in the Cloud
abstract: In this introductory chalk talk, we cover how to secure your resources in the cloud for common AWS workloads such as Amazon EC2 computing, database, and serverless. We cover security best practices recommended by AWS for each workload using simple and effective identity and networking techniques. Learn how and why these controls do what they do, and come away with the ability to interpret and apply AWS identity and network access controls.
rooms: Mirage, Mirage Event Center B, T2

title: Migrate Your On-Premises Data Warehouse to Amazon Redshift with AWS DMS and AWS SCT
abstract: Customers with on-premises data warehouses find them complex and expensive to manage, especially with respect to data load and performance. Amazon Redshift is a fast, simple, cost-effective data warehouse service that can extend queries to your data lake using your existing business intelligence tools. Migrating your on-premises data warehouse to Amazon Redshift can substantially improve query and data load performance, increase scalability, and save costs. This workshop leverages AWS Database Migration Service (AWS DMS) and AWS Schema Conversion Tool (AWS SCT) to migrate an existing Oracle data warehouse to Amazon Redshift. Prerequisites: an AWS account with IAM admin permissions and sufficient limits for the AWS resources above; a comfortable working knowledge of the AWS Management Console, relational databases, and Amazon Redshift.

title: Hybrid Cloud Storage for Recovery & Migration with AWS Storage Gateway
abstract: In this workshop, we provide hands-on experience using the AWS Storage Gateway service to protect on-premises data in AWS, recover it locally or in the cloud in minutes, and migrate it when the time is right. You work with the File Gateway and Microsoft SQL Server native tools to back up to Amazon S3, and then recover or migrate that database in AWS rapidly. In addition, you use Volume Gateway and Amazon EBS Snapshots to protect and migrate block-based volumes. Use this session to hone your skills with backup and DR, and prepare for application migrations.
rooms: Mirage, Mirage Event Center C1, T1

title: [REPEAT] Building Consumer Applications with AWS IoT Device Management
abstract: If you plan to build an IoT application for consumer devices, join us. In this session, learn how you can use AWS IoT Device Management to onboard and manage consumer devices from TVs to connected light bulbs. We demonstrate an example and deploy a firmware over-the-air (OTA) update to a set of malfunctioning connected light switches using AWS IoT Device Management. We then discuss best practices to solve fleet management challenges that you face today.

title: [REPEAT] Overlapping IP Addresses: How to Tackle VPC Peering
abstract: In this session, we connect two VPCs with overlapping IP addresses by building two solutions. These solutions use AWS PrivateLink, VPN, and NAT. We then analyze the design tradeoffs of each approach. Bring your laptops.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom B, Table 2, T1

title: [REPEAT] Increase Your Data Engineering Productivity: Use Jupyter Notebooks with Amazon EMR
abstract: Adoption of Jupyter Notebooks gives big data customers an easy way to leverage the open source Apache Spark in Amazon EMR for data science, interactive analytics, and to prototype jobs before bringing them to production. In this builders session, we show you how to make Amazon EMR an even simpler to use platform for developers and data engineers, increasing their productivity as they collaborate on different workloads and different clusters.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom D, Table 6, T1

title: [BS] Building Advanced Workflows with AWS Glue
abstract: AWS Glue makes it easy to incorporate data from a variety of sources into your data lake on Amazon S3. In this builders session, we demonstrate building complex workflows using AWS Glue orchestration capabilities. Learn about different types of AWS Glue triggers to create workflows for scheduled as well as event-driven processing. We start with a customer scenario and build it step by step using AWS Glue capabilities.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom D, Table 4, T1

title: [REPEAT 1] Build a Serverless Media Analysis & Image Processing Solution
abstract: Use AWS Step Functions along with Amazon Rekognition, Amazon Transcribe, and Amazon Comprehend to build a serverless application that extracts meaningful data from audio, image, and video files.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom B, Table 4, T1

title: [REPEAT 1] Build Knowledge Graphs with Amazon Neptune
abstract: Knowledge graphs are a powerful way to relate information. In this session, learn how to build a knowledge graph with Amazon Neptune by using Metaphactory.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom D, Table 5, T1

title: Crowdsourcing Data Collection with Amazon Mechanical Turk
abstract: One of the most expensive and time-consuming aspects of building your machine learning (ML) model is probably generating a high-quality dataset. Many times, all you have is a big bucket of raw, unlabeled data. Furthermore, the process of manually annotating massive datasets might be the most painful phase of your ML workflow. Crowdsourcing can be a great way to minimize the costs and the time it takes to collect and annotate data. Amazon Mechanical Turk makes accessing human intelligence simple, scalable, and cost-effective. In this workshop, learn how to use crowdsourcing to find still images to best represent scenes from a hit TV series, The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel, and identify and label items in those images to train an ML model.

title: [REPEAT 1] Creating a Chatbot
abstract: In this hands-on training session, we show you how to create a chatbot using Sumerian Hosts integrated with Amazon Polly and Amazon Lex. Bringing voice and conversation transforms the way in which scenes are developed and how customers interact with an app. Learn how to create a chatbot using both verbal and typed inputs and responses.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom B, Table 7, T1

title: [REPEAT 2] Which Database Should I Use?
abstract: Evaluating the best database to use for a job isn't as clear as it was ten years ago. Join us in this session to review your relational and nonrelational database options on AWS to ensure the best fit for your application. We also discuss related topics, such as managed database services, serverless databases, and heterogeneous migrations between different database types.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom D, Table 2, T1

title: [REPEAT 5] Build Your First Alexa Skill
abstract: We start from scratch, and in an hour, you will have an Alexa skill working end to end.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom B, Table 1, T1

title: [REPEAT 6] Designing the Voice User Interface for an Alexa Skill
abstract: In this session, discover the process of thinking through the design of a voice experience using intents, slots, entity resolution, and dialog management.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom D, Table 1, T1

title: Automated Solution for Deploying AWS Landing Zone
abstract: AWS Landing Zone is a new solution for accelerating customer’s on-boarding to AWS. It provides a consolidated collection of AWS best practices, prescriptive guidance, and templates for automatically configuring and securing AWS accounts, networks, and core services. In this workshop, you will learn the Landing Zone Solution design, targeted use cases, deployment procedures, and materials for the solution adoption. You will also see a live demo that illustrates the solution functions and the underlying mechanisms. Furthermore, you will gain firsthand experience by doing a Landing Zone Solution lab with solution configuration, deployment, and customization through CI/CD work flows. This workshop is for consulting and technology partners as well as customers. It is intended to be completed with a laptop. We encourage you to attend the full AWS Landing Zone track including SEC303; search for #awslandingzone in the session catalog.
rooms: Mirage, Mirage Event Center C3, T1

title: [REPEAT 3] Deploy and Scale a Multi-Tier Application with Amazon Lightsail
abstract: You're just getting started on your cloud journey. Perhaps you've deployed a simple application on AWS, but you're curious about how you can manage more complex workloads. In this session, we walk through some considerations to keep in mind when deploying multi-tier applications. We can even migrate one of your applications, or you can try it out on one of our demo apps.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom B, Table 8, T1

title: Customer Showcase for AWS IoT Analytics
abstract: See how our customers are using AWS IoT Analytics.

title: [REPEAT 1] Build a Genome Clustering Model with Amazon SageMaker
abstract: The development and application of machine learning (ML) models is a vital part of scientific and technical computing. Increasing model training data size generally improves model prediction and performance, but deploying models at scale is a challenge. Participants in this builder session learn to use Amazon SageMaker, an AWS service that simplifies the ML process and enables training on cloud-stored datasets at any scale. Attendees walk through the process of building a model, training it, and applying it for prediction against large open scientific datasets, such as the 1000 Genomes data. By the end of the session, attendees have the resources and experience to start using Amazon SageMaker and related AWS services to accelerate their scientific research and time to discovery.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom B, Table 3, T1

title: [REPEAT 1] Enterprise DevOps: Patterns of Efficiency
abstract: DevOps is a powerful movement that can help enterprises speed up their rate of innovation. But many large organizations struggle to implement DevOps at scale due to conflicts (real and perceived) with existing IT processes. Enterprise DevOps is the convergence of the speed and agility from modern development processes with the governance, security, and compliance control from traditional IT operations processes. In this session, learn how to implement enterprise DevOps in your organization through building a culture of inclusion, common sense, and continuous improvement. Also learn how to incorporate the knowledge from subject matter experts across your business into your automated DevOps guardrails to create the positive feedback loop we call "patterns of efficiency." This session contains actionable advice for leaders from IT as well as finance, compliance, and security departments.
rooms: Mirage, Mirage Event Center B, T2

title: [REPEAT 2] Get Started with Deep Learning and Computer Vision Using AWS DeepLens
abstract: If you're new to deep learning, this workshop is for you. Learn how to build and deploy computer vision models using the AWS DeepLens deep learning-enabled video camera. Also learn to build a machine learning application and a model from scratch using Amazon SageMaker. Finally, learn to extend that model to Amazon SageMaker to build an end-to-end AI application.

title: [REPEAT 1] Running SQL Server on Amazon RDS and Migrating to MySQL
abstract: If you'd like to move your SQL Server databases to the cloud, this workshop is for you. We review the basics of Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) and how SQL Server databases run in Amazon RDS. We then leverage the combination of AWS Schema Conversion Tool (AWS SCT) and AWS Database Migration Service (AWS DMS), and we show you how to migrate your databases to Amazon Aurora MySQL. We provide an AWS CloudFormation template to set up the entire environment for the lab. You need a laptop with a Firefox or Chrome browser and a working AWS account.

title: [REPEAT 1] Build, Train, and Deploy ML Models with Amazon SageMaker
abstract: Amazon SageMaker is a fully managed platform that enables developers and data scientists to build, train, and deploy machine learning (ML) models quickly and easily at any scale. In this workshop, learn how to build an ML model using Amazon SageMaker's built-in algorithms and frameworks. We then train the model using automatic model tuning to quickly achieve a high level of accuracy. Finally, we deploy the model in production so you can start generating predictions to achieve the best results. By the end of this workshop, expect to understand how Amazon SageMaker removes the complexity and barriers that typically slow down developers who want to use ML.
rooms: Mirage, Mirage Event Center C2, T2

title: [REPEAT 1] Securing Your Amazon Elasticsearch Service Domain
abstract: Amazon Elasticsearch Service (Amazon ES) provides security at several different layers. Let's talk about how you can integrate with Amazon Cognito to provide single sign-on for Kibana, how to deploy into your VPC, and how to get data into Amazon ES domains in VPC. We also talk about how to write your IAM policies to scope your users' interaction with the service.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom B, Table 1, T1

title: [REPEAT 2] Active Directory Domain Trusts and AWS SSO Jumpstart
abstract: Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to build a domain trust between on-premises Active Directory and AWS Managed AD in AWS. As a bonus, learn how to connect AWS Managed AD to AWS SSO.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom D, Table 2, T1

title: Use HPC on AWS for Physics-Based Simulation, ML, and Statistics in CAE
abstract: In this session, learn how an AWS HPC customer in the aerospace engineering segment migrated key parts of their computer-aided engineering (CAE) simulation and visualization applications to AWS to improve infrastructure redundancy for a robust process and user experience, achieving a system speed-up of 18X.

title: [REPEAT] Automate & Audit Cloud Governance & Compliance in Your Landing Zone
abstract: In this session, we explore landing zone considerations as they apply to compliance and auditing. We include such topics as a repeatable approach to SCP and IAM policy creation, internal separation of duty & "need to know", compliance scope ringfencing, Region scoping, scope of impact limitation, and mandatory access control. We review approaches for log and event analytics and log record lifecycle management (including redaction where necessary) and alerting. We also discuss how compliance assessment tools can be deployed in multi-account environments and their output sensibly interpreted. We encourage you to attend the full AWS Landing Zone track, including SEC303. Search for #awslandingzone in the session catalog.

title: [REPEAT 1] Shared Services VPCs: VPC Peering & AWS PrivateLink Designs
abstract: This is a hands-on session where you are guided on how to create a shared services VPC. Shared services VPCs often contain resources like authentication, security services, logging, and more. We provide examples of how to share these services over both AWS PrivateLink and VPC peering. Bring your laptops.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom D, Table 3, T1

title: [REPEAT 2] Build a .NET CI/CD Pipeline with AWS & AWS Tools for Visual Studio Team Services
abstract: Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to build a .NET CI/CD pipeline with AWS and AWS Tools for Visual Studio Team Services.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom D, Table 10, T1

title: [REPEAT] Best Practices for Working with Large-Scale Geospatial Imagery
abstract: Across the commercial and public sectors, companies are working with large geospatial datasets. In this session, we review how to use various services, including Amazon S3, Amazon Glacier, Amazon Athena, AWS Batch, and AWS Step Functions to store, process, and get insights into your large geospatial datasets.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom D, Table 7, T1

title: [CT] Deep Dive on Disaster Recovery IN the Cloud
abstract: While the cloud brings lots a world of new capabilities for data and application resilience, our always-on businesses still require a disaster recovery (DR) plan for cloud-based workloads. In this session, we discuss AWS solutions for ensuring business continuity and DR in both active-active and active-passive scenarios.

title: [REPEAT] Migrate Your SQL Server Database to Amazon RDS
abstract: If you're moving your SQL Server databases to the cloud, Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) provides you with several options. Join this session to learn about Amazon RDS for SQL Server, discuss the functionality that it supports, and see how to convert and migrate your database to Amazon Aurora for high performance and availability at one-tenth the cost.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom D, Table 1, T1

title: [REPEAT] Migrate Your Non-Relational Database to AWS
abstract: In this session, learn how to migrate your non-relational database, such as Cassandra or MongoDB, to Amazon DynamoDB. We review how AWS Database Migration Service (AWS DMS) and AWS Schema Conversion Tool (AWS SCT) can help you migrate quickly and securely, and we show you how DynamoDB implements the functionality of your source database.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom D, Table 5, T1

title: [REPEAT] Create Your First AR/VR Scene in 60 Minutes
abstract: This hands-on session, we provide an orientation to the Amazon Sumerian console, IDE, scene templates, and asset library. By the end of this session, all participants will know how to set up an account, establish a scene template, and develop their first scene.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom B, Table 6, T1

title: Migrating Financial and Accounting Systems from Oracle to Amazon DynamoDB
abstract: In this session, we discuss our learnings from migrating the financial ledger and accounting system that Amazon uses from Oracle to AWS. We share the performance and cost benefits to enterprises who migrate critical systems from Oracle to AWS, the decision frameworks used to pick the appropriate AWS service for appropriate application, and best practices in project management.

title: [REPEAT] Container Security and Avoiding the 2 AM Call
abstract: Containers are becoming one of the new normal infrastructures for deploying applications. One of the challenges that customers face is how to secure their applications. Traditional security practices and tools are designed for applications running directly on the hosts, whereas containers are virtualized and multi-tenant. In this session, learn about techniques that can be used to secure hosts, containers themselves, and the applications hosted in individual containers. We look at using Amazon ECS with Amazon EC2, AWS Fargate, and Amazon EKS, and we discuss what techniques and best practices to employ as part of CI/CD processes and for running applications.

title: [REPEAT 2] Best Practices for Amazon S3 and Amazon Glacier
abstract: Learn best practices for Amazon S3 performance optimization, security, data protection, storage management, and much more. In this session, we look at common Amazon S3 use cases and ways to manage large volumes of data within Amazon S3. We discuss the latest performance improvements and how they impact previous guidance. We also talk about the Amazon S3 data resilience model and how architecture for the AWS Regions and Availability Zones impact architecture for fault tolerance.
rooms: Mirage, Mirage Event Center B, T2

title: [REPEAT 1] Bridging Message Brokers to Cloud-Native Messaging Services
abstract: Learn how to connect your JMS-based applications to the cloud and integrate them with new cloud-native applications. In this session, we quickly refresh your knowledge about messaging enterprise integration patterns. We then discuss architectural examples to bridge the JMS-based and cloud-native worlds. We work through an example implementation based on Amazon MQ, Amazon SQS, and Amazon SNS. Leave this session with a solid understanding of how to connect existing applications to new cloud-native applications using messaging patterns.

title: [REPEAT] Amazon SageMaker and Apache MXNet: Tips & Tricks
abstract: In this session, learn how to use Apache MXNet in the Amazon SageMaker machine learning platform.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom B, Table 3, T1

title: HOT Lanes to the AWS Cloud: Optimize Network Design for AWS GovCloud (US)
abstract: The information superhighway is huge, complex, and often congested with traffic, especially to the cloud. Frustrated end users experience latency due to BGP and IP congestion, even on private networks like AWS Direct Connect. In this chalk talk, Verizon and AWS offer a tutorial on how best to design an optimal network, even for FedRAMP, IL 4-5, CJIS, and HIPAA compliance. Come armed with questions, and learn how this team created the successful HHS CMS network architecture.

title: [REPEAT 4] Migrate Your First SQL Server Database to Amazon RDS for SQL Server
abstract: With the approaching end of support for Microsoft SQL Server 2008, it is important to understand your options for upgrading the database layer of your existing applications. The fully managed Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) for SQL Server makes it easy to upgrade, set up, operate, and scale your SQL Server business applications for high availability. Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to learn how to migrate a SQL Server database to Amazon RDS.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom D, Table 1, T1

title: [REPEAT] Use Auto Scaling, Spot Pricing, and More Expert Strategies
abstract: Amazon EMR is a powerful service, enabling you to process and analyze big data at any scale. In this builders session, we share proven strategies to maximize your utilization while minimizing your costs for long-running clusters. We cover how to get the most leverage from features like Auto Scaling and Spot pricing. We also discuss how changing your design architecture by decoupling compute and storage impacts TCO. Not least, we show you how appropriately sizing instances, clusters, and jobs helps you save.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom D, Table 2, T1

title: Predicting Hospital Readmissions Using Amazon Machine Learning
abstract: According to the Center for Health Information and Analysis, hospital readmissions cost Medicare $26 billion annually, with $17 billion spent on avoidable hospital trips after discharge. In October 2012, the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) began reducing Medicare payments for Inpatient Prospective Payment System (IPPS) hospitals with excess readmissions via the Affordable Care Act. While datasets contain redundant information like patient demographics, most analysis algorithms rely on financial data, which omit the clinical nuances applicable to readmission patterns—creating a data analysis challenge that takes months to solve by conventional means. In this session, you apply advanced concepts, like pattern analysis and ML, to quickly perform risk stratification for patient cohorts based on a comprehensive dataset using Amazon Machine Learning, Amazon S3, Amazon Redshift, and Amazon EMR.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom B, Table 8, T1

title: [REPEAT 7] Add In-Skill Purchasing to an Alexa Skill
abstract: In this session, we start with a basic Alexa skill, and then we integrate in-skill purchasing to enable products to be purchased using voice.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom B, Table 2, T1

title: [REPEAT 7] Designing the Voice User Interface for an Alexa Skill
abstract: In this session, discover the process of thinking through the design of a voice experience using intents, slots, entity resolution, and dialog management.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom B, Table 5, T1

title: [REPEAT 1] Secure Your Site: Use CDN Security Features to Protect Your Content & Infrastructure
abstract: In this session, we review and configure several Amazon CloudFront security features such as TLS/SSL certificate management, security groups, OAI, token authentication, and field-level encryption.
rooms: Aria West, Level 3, Starvine 10, Table 6, T1

title: [REPEAT 6] Build Your First Alexa Skill
abstract: We start from scratch, and in an hour, you will have an Alexa skill working end to end.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom B, Table 1, T1

title: [REPEAT 1] Building Multi-Region Persistence with MySQL
abstract: In this session, participate in a hands-on exercise where you create, verify, and test a relational solution across multiple regions using AWS Fargate and Amazon Aurora, MySQL-compatible with multi-region Multi-Master.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom B, Table 6, T1

title: [REPEAT 1] Optimizing Your Immersive Application: Tips & Tricks from the Experts
abstract: In this this session, we provide insights into advanced settings to increase the performance of your scene by optimizing the environment, adjusting settings, modifying asset size, etc. Come prepared to raise questions, discuss challenges, and create solutions with experienced Amazon Sumerian experts.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom B, Table 9, T1

title: [REPEAT] Create Immersive Experiences Using Amazon Sumerian
abstract: Anyone can create and publish augmented reality (AR), virtual reality (VR), and 3D applications quickly and easily with Amazon Sumerian. In this session, learn how to use Sumerian to build a scene that can be published and viewed on laptops, mobile phones, VR headsets, and digital signage. Take a tour of the Sumerian interface, and learn how to build a scene, add assets and hosts, and add behaviors to create dynamically animated objects and characters in an AR/VR experience. Also see how Sumerian integrates into AWS services such as Amazon Polly, Amazon Lex, AWS Lambda, Amazon S3, and Amazon DynamoDB.

title: [REPEAT 3] How to Optimize TCO by Bringing Microsoft Licenses to AWS
abstract: Understanding the licensing options for Microsoft workloads on AWS is critical in achieving the lowest total cost of ownership (TCO) during a cloud migration. In this interactive session, we focus on best practices for bringing on-premises licenses to AWS, and we discuss how these choices impact TCO. Topics include license mobility, dedicated AWS infrastructure, development and testing, and the recently released Optimize CPU feature.
rooms: Mirage, Grand Ballroom B, Table 4, T1

title: [REPEAT] Optimize Machine Learning Training Using Amazon EC2 P3 Instances
abstract: In this workshop, you gain hands-on experience with Amazon EC2 P3 instances, powered by NVIDIA Tesla V100s, which offer the highest-performing GPU-based instances in the cloud for efficient model training. We walk through the entire machine learning (ML) application development lifecycle, and focus specifically on how to optimize training of ML models by leveraging the power of Amazon EC2 P3 instances.

title: [REPEAT] What's New with AWS CloudFormation
abstract: AWS CloudFormation is one of the most widely used tools in the AWS ecosystem, enabling infrastructure as code, deployment automation, repeatability, compliance, and standardization. In this session, we cover the latest improvements and best practices for AWS CloudFormation customers in particular, and for seasoned infrastructure engineers in general. We discuss new features and improvements that span many use cases, including programmability options, cross-region and cross-account automation, operational safety, and additional integration with many other AWS services.

title: Moving 400 Engineers to AWS: Our Journey to Secure Adoption
abstract: Join us, and learn how we made AWS our backbone, modularized our software for the cloud, and gained an immediate surge in velocity. In this session, we walk you through some of the unexpected security challenges we faced and hopefully save you a few headaches. Discover what security issues you need to address, how to avoid costly unused instances in your deployments, and why your current security tools won’t help. We show you how a major transformation landed us on AWS, and we share how we overcame challenges and advanced our business while innovating in a new direction. This session is brought to you by AWS partner, Barracuda Networks Inc.

title: Financial Svcs: Build Customer-Centric Contact Centers with Amazon Connect and Machine Learning
abstract: How can Financial Services companies meet growing customer demands for personalized, high-quality service while satisfying regulatory obligations? In this session, learn how Amazon Connect, a self-service, cloud-based contact center, can integrate with machine learning services on AWS such as Amazon Transcribe, Amazon Comprehend, and Amazon Lex to enable financial institutions to deliver transformational omni-channel experiences to their customers while complying with regulations like MiFID II, the GDPR, and the SEC's data retention rules. Learn how to use Amazon Connect to easily set up a cloud-based contact center solution that scales to support businesses of any size. Then learn how to integrate Amazon Connect with machine learning services on AWS to make contact center content available for search and analysis by natural language processing tools, which can yield valuable insights into customer sentiment, customer preferences, and the most common issues customers raise during service interactions.

title: Digital Transformation Through APIs
abstract: An effective API strategy is critical to digital transformation and rapid innovation. In this session, we deep dive into advanced capabilities of Amazon API Gateway that can enable customers to build modern applications.

title: [REPEAT] Best Practices for AWS IoT Core
abstract: There are many different components of AWS IoT Core, including Device gateway, Registry, Message broker, Rules engine, and Device shadow. In this session, we cover each component in depth, how to use them, and best practices. Come away with an understanding of how AWS IoT Core can help you securely connect and manage devices, process and act on device data, and read and set device state. In addition to best practices, we discuss common customer questions when using different features of AWS IoT Core.

title: [CT] Metrics-Driven Performance Tuning for AWS Glue ETL Jobs
abstract: AWS Glue provides a horizontally scalable platform for running ETL jobs against a wide variety of data sources. In this builder's session, we cover techniques for understanding and optimizing the performance of your jobs using AWS Glue job metrics. Learn how to identify bottlenecks on the driver and executors, identify and fix data skew, tune the number of DPUs, and address common memory errors.

title: Running Your SQL Server Database on Amazon RDS
abstract: In this session, learn how to run SQL Server on Amazon RDS, best practices for migration from on-premises or Amazon EC2 into Amazon RDS, and the pros and cons of running in Amazon RDS for SQL Server today. We also discuss workarounds for customer needs that are not supported today with Amazon RDS.

title: Drug Discovery Innovation in a Precompetitive Cloud Platform
abstract: Informatics systems used by research scientists today have significant limitations, since they come from many vendors, use different data formats, and were developed with various UI standards. These limitations create barriers to accessing and integrating heterogeneous, siloed research data in a meaningful way to facilitate innovation and collaboration. In this session, Accenture and Merck discuss the expanded capabilities and benefits—for drug discovery organizations and software providers—of a newly launched research platform that gives the research science world a highly elastic, cloud infrastructure with a single UI and advanced computing power that accelerates drug discovery activities and enables competitive differentiation. This session is brought to you by AWS partner, Accenture.

title: Astro’s Digital Transformation Journey
abstract: Astro is the leading media and digital content company in Malaysia and Southeast Asia, entertaining audiences on TV, radio, digital, and commerce platforms. While the media industry has been disrupted as consumers shift to online consumption of content, Astro has been transforming along with it. In this session, Astro’s COO discusses how they embarked on a three-year Digital Transformation Program with Amazon to build a sustained culture of innovation through enablement, experimentation, and working across the organization. They share their experiences with their idea incubation and Certified Innovator Program, which has trained more than 1,000 associates. They also recount their technology transformation, undertaken in parallel to drive increased agility for product development and new data-driven insights for decision making.

title: [REPEAT] Backing Up Amazon EC2 with Amazon EBS Snapshots
abstract: With Amazon EBS, you can easily create a simple point-in-time backup for your Amazon EC2 instances. In this deep dive session, you learn how to use Amazon EBS snapshots to back up your Amazon EC2 environment. We review how snapshots work, and we share best practices for tagging snapshots, cost management, and snapshot automation.

title: Unsupervised Learning with Amazon SageMaker
abstract: How do you use machine learning with data that isn't labeled? The unsupervised learning capabilities of Amazon SageMaker can easily handle unlabeled data. In this chalk talk, we discuss the intricacies of unsupervised algorithms that are built into Amazon SageMaker, including clustering with k-means and anomaly detection with Random Cut Forest.

title: [REPEAT 1] Automate Testing & Deployment of Modern Serverless Apps
abstract: Continuous deployment enables you to be more productive and deliver a more stable product. In this session, learn how to utilize CI/CD techniques when deploying AWS services like AWS Step Functions, Amazon API Gateway, and AWS Lambda resources. Get into the nuts and bolts of handling versions, testing, and deploying using AWS CodePipeline, and monitoring performance using Amazon CloudWatch.

title: [REPEAT] SaaS Jumpstart: A Primer for Launching Your SaaS Journey
abstract: Adopting a SaaS model is no trivial effort. Wandering into the universe of multi-tenancy means tackling a broad range of new architectural challenges. How do you automate the onboarding and provisioning of new tenants? How do you secure a shared multi-tenant infrastructure and prevent any flavor of cross-tenant access? How do you effectively partition tenant data? These are amongst a core set SaaS architecture topics in this chalk which is aimed at equipping SaaS newcomers with a clear view of some of the best practices associated with delivering SaaS solutions on AWS. The goal here is to explore and discuss fundamental architectural strategies of SaaS and highlight key considerations that will shape the security, agility, and success of your SaaS applications.

title: [REPEAT] Moving to DevOps the Amazon Way
abstract: DevOps is currently one of the most sought after engineering models. One reason is that it helps enterprise transformations. The Amazon transformation to DevOps was born out of the desire to be even more customer obsessed, more agile, and more innovative. Come and learn from our journey as we share the playbook that helped us successfully implement and adopt DevOps as well as the lessons we learned the hard way.

title: Maximize Cloud Elasticity and Agility in 5 Easy Steps
abstract: Many customers lack the experience and skills to optimize performance and cost in the cloud. The breadth of AWS offerings meets any application need at any time. However, realizing full elasticity while adapting to dynamic application demands is a challenge that is beyond human scale. AI-powered software is the answer. Turbonomic workload automation lets applications self-manage cloud resources, anywhere, in real time, making intelligent sizing and placement decisions for cloud migrations. In this session, we discuss how an oil and gas company used the Turbonomic AI-powered decision engine to make the right continuous tradeoffs, maximizing efficiency without sacrificing elasticity. This session is brought to you by AWS partner, Turbonomic.

title: [REPEAT 1] Running Lean Architectures: How to Optimize for Cost Efficiency
abstract: Aimed at solutions architects and technical managers, this session focuses on the practical ways our customers achieve cost-efficient architectures through service selection and configuration. We start by discussing the building block services. We cover the main trends, such as containers and serverless, and we explore some of the specific services and configurations customers have used. We also take you through real-life examples that can be implemented to minimize costs while driving innovation and business output. After you attend this session, you will understand what is possible on AWS, and you will know ways in which you can deploy new workloads or modify existing workloads for optimization.

title: Vonage & Aspect: Transform Real-Time Communications & Customer Engagement
abstract: In this session, learn from market-leader Vonage how and why they re-architected their QoS-sensitive, highly available and highly performant legacy real-time communications systems to take advantage of Amazon EC2, Enhanced Networking, Amazon S3, ASG, Amazon RDS, Amazon ElastiCache, AWS Lambda, StepFunctions, Amazon SNS, Amazon SQS, Amazon Kinesis, Amazon EFS, and more.
